name: Grow
description:
I shop like my mother
Two sizes too big
Frugality demands-
They'll grow into it

Like little penguins in
Oversized jackets
Sleeves dangling - 
Bodies swollen with fabric 

Cuffs drag across concrete
And waistbands fall
Jump, bounce - 
An endless tug of war

And while they rush about
I turn to the sink
Hands in hot water-
Wash, rinse and repeat. 

And repeat
And repeat

MUM! 

I turn with a jump
It comes as a shock
I want to say the fabric had shrunk
But a kid had shot up

Wrists and ankles now exposed 
A tee-shirt that tugs
Time had flowed past-
This latest growth spurt


I shop like my mother
Two sizes too big 
And try to watch every moment 
As they grow into it
